articles.title: What is the Squires App?
articles.summary: Overview of the Squires digital forms management system.
articles.content_md:
# What is the Squires App?

The Squires App is a custom-built digital forms management system designed for A&V Squires Plant Co. Ltd. It replaces paper-based forms with a modern, mobile-first Progressive Web Application (PWA) accessible from any device.

## Key Features

- **Employee Timesheets** - Digital weekly timesheets with automatic hour calculations
- **Vehicle Inspections** - Dynamic safety checklists based on vehicle type (Vans get 14 items, Trucks/Artics/Trailers get 26 items)
- **RAMS Documents** - Risk Assessment & Method Statement management with visitor signatures
- **Absence Management** - Request and track annual leave with calendar view
- **Fleet Management** - Track MOT, tax, service schedules, and manage vehicles
- **Workshop Tasks** - Manage vehicle repairs with categories, status tracking, and comments
- **Approvals** - Manager review and approval workflows for timesheets and absences
- **Reports** - Export data as PDF or Excel files

## Access

The app is available at: https://avsworklog.mpdee.uk

It works on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. For the best mobile experience, add it to your home screen as a PWA.

articles.title: How do I log in?
articles.summary: Instructions for logging into the app.
articles.content_md:
# How do I log in?

1. Go to https://avsworklog.mpdee.uk
2. Enter your email address
3. Enter your password
4. Click **Sign In**

## First Time Login

If this is your first login, an admin will have created your account and sent you a temporary password by email. You'll be required to change this password on first login.

## Forgot Password?

Contact your administrator to reset your password. They can generate a new temporary password from the User Management page.

articles.title: How do I change my password?
articles.summary: Instructions for changing your password.
articles.content_md:
# How do I change my password?

If you need to change your password (either because it's your first login or you want to update it):

1. You'll be automatically redirected to the Change Password page if a change is required
2. Enter your new password (must meet security requirements)
3. Confirm the new password
4. Click **Change Password**

## Password Requirements

- Minimum length as set by system
- Should be unique and not easily guessed

## Forgot Your Password?

Ask your administrator to reset it from the User Management page.

articles.title: Understanding the Dashboard
articles.summary: Guide to the main dashboard and navigation.
articles.content_md:
# Understanding the Dashboard

The Dashboard is your home screen after logging in. It shows quick actions and important status information.

## Welcome Section

At the top, you'll see a welcome message with your name and role.

## Quick Actions (Large Square Buttons)

Based on your permissions, you'll see large colored buttons for:
- **Timesheets** (blue) - Create/view timesheets
- **Inspections** (yellow) - Perform vehicle inspections
- **RAMS** (green) - View assigned RAMS documents
- **Absence** (purple) - Request annual leave
- **Maintenance** (red) - View fleet maintenance schedules
- **Workshop** (brown) - View workshop tasks
- **Help** - Access this FAQ system

If you have RAMS documents to sign, a red badge shows the count.

## Management Tools (Smaller Cards)

Managers and Admins see additional cards:
- **Approvals** (blue) - Review submitted forms
- **Actions** (purple) - Manager actions hub
- **Toolbox Talks** (red) - Send safety messages
- **Reports** (green) - Download reports
- **Users** (grey, Admin only) - Manage user accounts
- **Vehicles** (grey, Admin only) - Manage fleet

## Pending Approvals Card

Managers see a summary card showing:
- Pending timesheet count
- Pending absence request count
- Quick link to Approvals page

## Manager Actions Card

Managers see a summary showing:
- Workshop Tasks counts (Pending, In Progress, Completed)
- Maintenance alerts (Overdue, Due Soon)
- Site Audit Inspections (Coming Soon badge)

articles.title: How to install the app on my phone
articles.summary: Add the Squires App to your home screen for the best mobile experience.
articles.content_md:
# How to install the app on my phone

The Squires App is a Progressive Web App (PWA) that can be installed on your phone for an app-like experience.

## iPhone (Safari)

1. Open Safari and go to https://avsworklog.mpdee.uk
2. Tap the **Share** button (square with arrow)
3. Scroll down and tap **Add to Home Screen**
4. Tap **Add** in the top right

## Android (Chrome)

1. Open Chrome and go to https://avsworklog.mpdee.uk
2. Tap the **three dots** menu in the top right
3. Tap **Add to Home screen**
4. Tap **Add**

## Benefits

- Launch directly from your home screen
- App-like full-screen experience
- Works offline for viewing previously loaded data
- Faster access without opening a browser

articles.title: What are the different user roles?
articles.summary: Explanation of Employee, Manager, and Admin roles.
articles.content_md:
# What are the different user roles?

The app has three main role types that determine what you can access:

## Employee

- Create and submit timesheets
- Perform vehicle inspections
- View and sign assigned RAMS documents
- Request annual leave
- View maintenance schedules
- View assigned workshop tasks
- Access the Help page

## Manager

Everything an Employee can do, plus:
- Approve/reject timesheets and absences
- Access the Manager Actions hub
- View and manage Workshop Tasks
- Send Toolbox Talks and Reminders
- Download reports
- Create timesheets/inspections on behalf of employees
- View all employees' data
- Manage suggestions

## Admin

Everything a Manager can do, plus:
- Create, edit, and delete user accounts
- Reset user passwords
- Manage roles and permissions
- Manage vehicle fleet and categories
- Upload and manage RAMS documents
- Edit FAQ content
- Configure system settings

## Super Admin

A special protected account (admin@mpdee.co.uk) that cannot be locked out or modified by other admins. Has full system access and special developer tools.

articles.title: How do I create a new timesheet?
articles.summary: Step-by-step guide to creating and submitting a weekly timesheet.
articles.content_md:
# How do I create a new timesheet?

## Quick Steps

1. Go to **Timesheets** from the dashboard or navigation
2. Click the **New Timesheet** button
3. Select the **Week Ending** date (must be a Sunday)
4. The system checks if a timesheet already exists for that week
5. Fill in each day's hours using the day tabs (Mon-Sun)
6. Add your digital signature
7. Click **Submit**

## Week Selector

Before entering data, you'll see the Week Selector:
- Choose which Sunday ends your timesheet week
- Only Sundays can be selected
- If a timesheet already exists for that week, you'll be prompted to edit it instead

## Entering Daily Hours

For each day:
1. Click the day tab (Mon, Tue, etc.)
2. Enter **Start Time** and **End Time**
3. Hours are calculated automatically
4. Optionally add a **Job Number**
5. Add any **Remarks** if needed

## Special Options

- **In Yard** - Mark if you worked in the yard that day
- **Did Not Work** - Mark days you didn't work (sick, leave, weekend, etc.)

## Important Rules

- All 7 days must have hours entered OR be marked as "Did Not Work"
- You cannot submit a timesheet for a week that already has one
- A digital signature is required before submission

## Saving Drafts

Click **Save Draft** at any time to save your progress without submitting. You can return later to complete and submit.

articles.title: How do I edit a timesheet?
articles.summary: Instructions for editing draft or rejected timesheets.
articles.content_md:
# How do I edit a timesheet?

## When Can I Edit?

You can only edit timesheets with these statuses:
- **Draft** - Not yet submitted
- **Rejected** - Returned by manager with comments

Approved or processed timesheets cannot be edited.

## How to Edit

1. Go to **Timesheets**
2. Find the timesheet in the list
3. Click on it to open
4. You'll be taken to the edit form automatically
5. Make your changes
6. Click **Save** or **Submit**

## After Rejection

If your timesheet was rejected:
1. Read the manager's comments (shown at the top or indicated by "See manager comments")
2. Make the requested corrections
3. Update your signature if needed
4. Re-submit the timesheet

articles.title: What do timesheet statuses mean?
articles.summary: Explanation of Draft, Submitted, Approved, Rejected, Processed, and Adjusted statuses.
articles.content_md:
# What do timesheet statuses mean?

## Draft

Timesheet is saved but not submitted. Only you can see it. You can continue editing.

## Submitted (shows as "Pending")

Timesheet has been submitted for manager approval. You cannot edit until reviewed. Shows an amber clock icon.

## Approved

Manager has approved the timesheet. Shows a green checkmark. It will be processed for payroll.

## Rejected

Manager has returned the timesheet with comments. Shows a red X. Read the feedback, make corrections, and re-submit.

## Processed

Timesheet has been processed for payroll. Shows a blue package icon. This is the final status for normal timesheets.

## Adjusted

The timesheet was adjusted after approval (rare case for corrections). Shows an amber warning icon.

articles.title: How do I download a timesheet as PDF?
articles.summary: Instructions for downloading timesheet PDFs.
articles.content_md:
# How do I download a timesheet as PDF?

PDF download is available for submitted, approved, processed, and adjusted timesheets.

## From the Timesheet List

1. Go to **Timesheets**
2. Find the timesheet you want
3. Click the **Download PDF** button on the card
4. The PDF will download to your device

## What's Included

- Employee name and details
- Week ending date
- Registration number (if assigned)
- All daily entries with hours
- Job numbers and remarks
- Total hours
- Employee signature
- Submission date

articles.title: Can I delete a timesheet?
articles.summary: Information about deleting timesheets.
articles.content_md:
# Can I delete a timesheet?

## For Employees

Employees cannot delete timesheets. If you have a draft you no longer need, you can leave it and create a new one for a different week.

## For Managers

Managers can delete any timesheet:

1. Go to **Timesheets**
2. Find the timesheet in the list
3. Click the red **trash** icon
4. Confirm the deletion

**Warning:** Deleting a timesheet permanently removes it and all its entries. This cannot be undone.

articles.title: How do I filter timesheets?
articles.summary: Using status filters and employee filters on the timesheets page.
articles.content_md:
# How do I filter timesheets?

## For Managers

Managers have additional filtering options:

### Employee Filter

At the top of the page:
1. Click the **View timesheets for** dropdown
2. Select a specific employee or "All Employees"

### Status Filter

Filter buttons to show:
- **All** - Every timesheet
- **Draft** - Saved but not submitted
- **Pending** - Awaiting approval
- **Approved** - Approved by manager
- **Rejected** - Returned to employee
- **Processed** - Processed for payroll
- **Adjusted** - Modified after approval

## For Employees

Employees see only their own timesheets. The list shows most recent first.

articles.title: How do I perform a vehicle inspection?
articles.summary: Step-by-step guide to completing a vehicle safety inspection.
articles.content_md:
# How do I perform a vehicle inspection?

## Quick Steps

1. Go to **Inspections** from the dashboard
2. Click **New Inspection**
3. Select the **Vehicle** from the dropdown (or add a new one)
4. Select the **Week Ending** date (must be a Sunday)
5. Enter the current **Mileage**
6. Complete the checklist for each day
7. Click **Submit Inspection**

## Vehicle Selection

When you select a vehicle, the checklist automatically adjusts based on the vehicle type:
- **Vans** get a 14-point checklist
- **Trucks, Artics, Trailers** get a 26-point checklist

## The Checklist

For each item, you must mark it as:
- **Pass** (green tick) - Item is satisfactory
- **Fail** (red X) - Item has a defect or issue

**Important:** If you mark an item as **Fail**, you MUST add a comment explaining the defect.

## Daily Tabs

Use the Mon-Sun tabs to fill in each day:
- A green checkmark on a tab indicates all items are complete for that day
- Progress is shown at the top (e.g., "45/98" for a 14-item Van checklist over 7 days)

## Locked Fields

Once you start filling the checklist, the vehicle and week ending become locked. This prevents accidentally mixing data between vehicles.

## Save as Draft

Click **Save Draft** at any time to save progress. Return later to complete and submit.

articles.title: What happens when I report a defect?
articles.summary: How defects are tracked, locked, and resolved.
articles.content_md:
# What happens when I report a defect?

When you mark an inspection item as **Fail** (defect):

## Automatic Workshop Task Creation

1. A Workshop Task is automatically created for the defect
2. The task appears in the Workshop Tasks page
3. Managers are notified to review

## Adding Details

Always add:
- **Comments** describing the defect (REQUIRED)
- The more detail, the easier for workshop to fix

## Defect Locking System

Once a manager marks a defect as **Logged**, **In Progress**, or **On Hold**:

- The defect becomes **read-only** on future inspections
- You'll see a "üîí LOGGED DEFECT" badge on the item
- The manager's comment is shown
- The item is automatically marked as Failed for all days
- You cannot change this status until management resolves it

This prevents conflicting reports while a defect is being worked on.

## Resolving Previous Defects

If an item was defective in a previous inspection and you want to mark it OK:

1. Select **Pass** on the item
2. A **Resolution Required** dialog appears
3. Enter an explanation (e.g., "Light bulb replaced by Dave on Wednesday")
4. Click **Mark as Resolved**

This creates an audit trail showing how the defect was fixed.

articles.title: What do inspection statuses mean?
articles.summary: Explanation of inspection status workflow.
articles.content_md:
# What do inspection statuses mean?

## Draft

Inspection is saved but not complete. You can continue editing. Shows as a grey file icon.

## Submitted

Inspection is submitted. Any defects will be actioned by managers. Shows as a green checkmark.

Note: Unlike timesheets, inspections don't require manager "approval" - they're submitted and defects are tracked separately through Workshop Tasks.

articles.title: How do I add a new vehicle during inspection?
articles.summary: Adding a vehicle that isn't in the system yet.
articles.content_md:
# How do I add a new vehicle during inspection?

If the vehicle you're inspecting isn't in the dropdown list:

1. Click the **Vehicle** dropdown
2. Select **Add New Vehicle** at the top (highlighted in yellow)
3. A dialog appears - enter:
   - **Registration Number** (required)
   - **Vehicle Category** (required) - Van, Truck, Artic, or Trailer
4. Click **Add Vehicle**

The vehicle is added to the system and automatically selected. The checklist updates based on the category chosen.

articles.title: Why can't I create an inspection?
articles.summary: Understanding duplicate inspection prevention.
articles.content_md:
# Why can't I create an inspection?

The system prevents duplicate inspections for the same vehicle and week.

## Duplicate Detection

If you see an error: "An inspection for this vehicle and week already exists"

This means:
- An inspection already exists for that vehicle + week ending combination
- You need to either:
  - Select a different vehicle
  - Select a different week ending date
  - Edit the existing inspection instead

## Finding Existing Inspections

1. Go to **Inspections**
2. Look for the inspection in the list
3. Click to view or edit it

articles.title: What is RAMS?
articles.summary: Overview of the RAMS document system.
articles.content_md:
# What is RAMS?

RAMS stands for **Risk Assessment and Method Statement**. These are important safety documents that outline:

- Potential hazards for a task or site
- Safety measures and procedures
- Method of work to be followed

## Legal Requirement

RAMS documents are legally required to ensure workers understand the risks and safety procedures before starting work.

## In the App

Managers upload RAMS documents and assign them to relevant employees. You must:
1. Read the document
2. Sign to confirm you've read and understood it

## Document Status

Each RAMS document shows:
- **Needs Signature** (red badge) - You haven't signed yet
- **Signed** (green badge) - You've read and signed

articles.title: How do I view and sign RAMS documents?
articles.summary: Instructions for reading and signing assigned RAMS.
articles.content_md:
# How do I view and sign RAMS documents?

## Viewing Your Assigned RAMS

1. Go to **RAMS** from the dashboard or navigation
2. You'll see a list of RAMS documents assigned to you
3. Documents show status: **Needs Signature** or **Signed**

## Filtering

Use the filter buttons:
- **All** - Show all documents
- **Pending** - Documents needing signature
- **Signed** - Documents you've already signed

Use the search bar to find documents by title.

## Signing a RAMS Document

1. Click **Read & Sign** on a pending document
2. Read the PDF document (it opens in a viewer)
3. Scroll through to confirm you've read it
4. Click the **Sign** button
5. Your digital signature and timestamp are recorded

## After Signing

Signed documents remain accessible for reference. Click **View Document** to re-read them.

articles.title: How do visitors sign RAMS documents?
articles.summary: Recording visitor signatures for site safety compliance.
articles.content_md:
# How do visitors sign RAMS documents?

For site visitors who need to acknowledge RAMS documents but don't have app accounts.

**Note:** You must have signed the document yourself before recording visitor signatures.

## Recording a Visitor Signature

1. Go to **RAMS**
2. Find the relevant document (must be one you've signed)
3. Click **Record Visitor** button
4. A modal appears - enter:
   - **Visitor's Full Name** (required)
5. Have the visitor sign on the signature pad
6. Click **Submit Signature**

## What Gets Recorded

- Visitor's name
- Digital signature
- Timestamp
- Which RAMS document they signed
- Who recorded the signature (you)

This creates a compliance record for site visitors.

articles.title: How do I upload RAMS documents? (Managers)
articles.summary: Instructions for uploading and assigning RAMS documents.
articles.content_md:
# How do I upload RAMS documents? (Managers)

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Accessing RAMS Management

1. Go to **RAMS**
2. Click **Manage RAMS** button (gear icon)

## Uploading a New RAMS

1. Click **Upload New RAMS**
2. Fill in:
   - **Title** - Clear name for the document
   - **Description** - Brief summary
   - **PDF File** - The RAMS document (PDF format, size limits apply)
3. Click **Upload**

## Assigning to Employees

After uploading:
1. Find the RAMS in the management list
2. Click **Assign Employees** or the assign button
3. Select employees who need to sign:
   - Use checkboxes to select individuals
   - Or use "Select All" for everyone
4. Click **Assign**

Assigned employees will see the document in their RAMS page with "Needs Signature" status.

articles.title: How do I request annual leave?
articles.summary: Instructions for submitting an annual leave request.
articles.content_md:
# How do I request annual leave?

## Summary Card

At the top of the Absence page, you'll see your annual leave summary for the current UK financial year (April to April):
- **Total Allowance** - Your yearly entitlement
- **Approved Taken** - Days already used
- **Pending** - Days in pending requests
- **Remaining** - Days still available

## Making a Request

1. Go to **Absence** from the dashboard
2. Click **Request Annual Leave** to expand the form
3. Fill in:
   - **Start Date** - First day of leave
   - **End Date** - Last day (optional for single-day requests)
   - **Half Day** - Check if taking only half a day (AM or PM)
   - **Notes** - Any additional information
4. Review the **Request Summary** showing calculated days
5. Click **Submit Request**

## Half-Day Requests

For half-days:
1. Check the **Half Day** box
2. Select **AM** or **PM**
3. End date is automatically disabled (half-days are single-day only)

## Allowance Check

The system prevents over-booking:
- **Projected Remaining** shows what's left after this request
- If negative, you'll see a warning and can't submit

articles.title: How do I use the absence calendar?
articles.summary: Understanding the calendar view and day interactions.
articles.content_md:
# How do I use the absence calendar?

## Calendar View

The calendar shows the current month in the UK financial year:
- Use **arrows** to navigate months
- Navigate through April (start) to March (end) of the financial year

## Color Coding

- üü£ **Purple dot** - Approved annual leave
- üü° **Amber dot** - Pending request
- üîµ **Blue dot** - Other absence type

## For Managers/Admins

Managers see all employees on the calendar:
- Each day shows employee names with bullet points
- Use the **Filter** button to select which employees to display
- Click checkboxes to show/hide specific employees

## Clicking a Day

Click any day to:
- See what absences are booked for that date
- Start a new request for that day (if no absences)

articles.title: How do I cancel an absence request?
articles.summary: Instructions for cancelling a pending or approved absence.
articles.content_md:
# How do I cancel an absence request?

## From My Bookings Tab

1. Go to **Absence**
2. Click the **My Bookings** tab
3. Find your request in the list
4. Click **Cancel** button
5. Confirm cancellation

## When Can I Cancel?

You can cancel:
- **Pending requests** - Any time before they're reviewed
- **Approved requests** - Only if the start date is in the future

You cannot cancel:
- Requests that have already started
- Requests in the past

articles.title: How do I manage absences? (Managers)
articles.summary: Approve/reject requests and configure settings.
articles.content_md:
# How do I manage absences? (Managers)

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Accessing Management

1. Go to **Absence**
2. Click the **Manage Absence** button (top right)

## What You Can Do

### View All Requests

- See pending requests from all employees
- Filter by status (Pending, Approved, Rejected)

### Approve/Reject

- Click on a request to view details
- **Approve** - Grant the leave request
- **Reject** - Decline with optional reason

### Configure Settings

- Set absence reasons (Annual Leave, Sick, etc.)
- Configure which reasons require approval
- Manage employee allowances

articles.title: What is Fleet Management?
articles.summary: Overview of the Fleet page and its tabs.
articles.content_md:
# What is Fleet Management?

Fleet Management is a unified page with three tabs for managing vehicles and their maintenance.

## Accessing Fleet

Click **Maintenance** from the dashboard, or go to **Fleet** directly.

## Tabs

### Maintenance Tab (All Users)

View maintenance status for all vehicles:
- Summary cards showing overdue and due soon counts
- Searchable vehicle list
- Status indicators for each maintenance type

### Vehicles Tab (Managers/Admins)

Manage the vehicle fleet:
- Add, edit, delete vehicles
- Assign vehicle categories
- View vehicle details

### Settings Tab (Managers/Admins)

Configure maintenance settings:
- Warning thresholds
- Manage vehicle categories
- Configure which maintenance types are tracked

articles.title: How do I view vehicle maintenance status?
articles.summary: Understanding the maintenance overview.
articles.content_md:
# How do I view vehicle maintenance status?

## Maintenance Tab Overview

### Summary Cards

At the top, you'll see:
- **Overdue** (red) - Items past their due date
- **Due Soon** (amber) - Items due within the warning period

### Vehicle List

Each vehicle row shows:
- **Registration** and nickname (if set)
- **Status columns** for each maintenance type:
  - Tax
  - MOT
  - Service
  - Cambelt (if applicable)
  - First Aid Kit

### Status Colors

- üü¢ **Green** - OK (not due soon)
- üü° **Amber** - Due Soon (within warning period)
- üî¥ **Red** - Overdue
- ‚ö™ **Grey (N/A)** - Not applicable or not tracked

### Search

Use the search bar to find vehicles by registration number.

## Vehicle History

Click on a vehicle row to see its maintenance history and update records.

articles.title: How do I manage vehicles? (Admin)
articles.summary: Add, edit, and organize vehicles.
articles.content_md:
# How do I manage vehicles? (Admin)

**Note:** The Vehicles tab is for Managers and Admins only.

## Accessing Vehicles Tab

1. Go to **Fleet**
2. Click the **Vehicles** tab

## Adding a Vehicle

1. Click **Add Vehicle**
2. Enter:
   - **Registration Number** (required)
   - **Nickname** (optional friendly name)
   - **Category** - Van, Truck, Artic, or Trailer
   - **Status** - Active or Inactive
3. Click **Save**

## Editing a Vehicle

1. Find the vehicle in the list
2. Click the **Edit** (pencil) icon
3. Update details
4. Save changes

## Vehicle Categories

Categories determine:
- Which inspection checklist is used
- How vehicles are grouped

Manage categories from the **Settings** tab.

articles.title: How do I manage vehicle categories?
articles.summary: Creating and editing vehicle categories.
articles.content_md:
# How do I manage vehicle categories?

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Accessing Category Management

1. Go to **Fleet**
2. Click the **Settings** tab
3. Find the **Vehicle Categories** section

## Adding a Category

1. Click **Add Category**
2. Enter:
   - **Name** (e.g., "7.5t Box Van")
   - **Description** (optional)
3. Click **Save**

## Editing Categories

- Click the **Edit** icon to modify a category
- Click the **Delete** icon to remove (only if no vehicles use it)

## Standard Categories

The system includes:
- **Van** - Uses 14-point inspection checklist
- **Truck** - Uses 26-point inspection checklist
- **Artic** - Uses 26-point inspection checklist
- **Trailer** - Uses 26-point inspection checklist

articles.title: What is Workshop Tasks?
articles.summary: Overview of the workshop task management system.
articles.content_md:
# What is Workshop Tasks?

Workshop Tasks is a dedicated module for tracking vehicle repairs and maintenance work.

## Accessing Workshop Tasks

Click **Workshop** from the dashboard or navigation.

## Key Features

- **Task categories and subcategories** - Organize work by type
- **Status tracking** - Pending ‚Üí Logged ‚Üí In Progress ‚Üí On Hold ‚Üí Completed
- **Comments system** - Add notes and updates to tasks
- **Auto-created from inspections** - Defects automatically create tasks
- **Completion tracking** - Record mileage and completion notes

## Task Sources

Tasks can come from:
1. **Inspection Defects** - Automatically created when inspections have failures
2. **Manual Creation** - Managers can create tasks directly

## Who Can Access

- **All users** can view Workshop Tasks (if permission granted)
- **Managers/Admins** can create, edit, and manage tasks

articles.title: How do I view workshop tasks?
articles.summary: Understanding the workshop tasks page layout.
articles.content_md:
# How do I view workshop tasks?

## Page Layout

The Workshop Tasks page shows tasks organized in collapsible sections:

### Sections

- **Pending** (open by default) - Tasks not yet started
- **In Progress** (open by default) - Tasks being worked on
- **On Hold** (collapsed) - Tasks paused
- **Completed** (collapsed) - Finished tasks

Click the section header to expand/collapse.

## Filters

### Status Filter

Use the dropdown to show:
- All tasks
- Pending only
- In Progress only
- On Hold only
- Completed only

### Vehicle Filter

Filter to show tasks for a specific vehicle.

## Task Cards

Each task shows:
- **Vehicle** registration and nickname
- **Category** and subcategory
- **Description** of the work needed
- **Priority** badge (if set)
- **Status** indicator
- **Created date**

articles.title: How do I create a workshop task? (Managers)
articles.summary: Creating manual workshop tasks.
articles.content_md:
# How do I create a workshop task? (Managers)

**Note:** Managers and Admins can create tasks. Tasks are also auto-created from inspection defects.

## Creating a Task

1. Go to **Workshop Tasks**
2. Click **Add Task** button
3. Fill in:
   - **Vehicle** - Select from dropdown
   - **Category** - Select task category
   - **Subcategory** - Select if applicable
   - **Description/Comments** - What needs doing
   - **Mileage** - Current vehicle mileage (optional)
4. Click **Create Task**

## Auto-Created Tasks

When someone submits a vehicle inspection with defects:
- A workshop task is automatically created
- Linked to the inspection
- Shows the defect details
- Appears in the Pending section

articles.title: How do I update a workshop task status?
articles.summary: Changing task status and adding completion details.
articles.content_md:
# How do I update a workshop task status?

## Status Flow

Tasks follow this workflow:

```
Pending ‚Üí Logged ‚Üí In Progress ‚Üí Completed
              ‚Üì           ‚Üì
          On Hold ‚Üê‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

## Status Actions

Click on a task to open it, then use the action buttons:

### From Pending

- **Mark In Progress** - Opens dialog for a short comment (e.g., "Parts on order")
- **Mark Complete** - Jump straight to completion

### From In Progress

- **Put On Hold** - Pause the task (e.g., waiting for parts)
- **Mark Complete** - Finish the task

### From On Hold

- **Resume** - Continue working (returns to In Progress)
- **Mark Complete** - Finish the task

## Marking Complete

When completing a task:

1. Click **Mark Complete**
2. A dialog appears asking for:
   - **Completion Notes** - What was done
   - **Mileage** - Vehicle mileage at completion
   - **Category Updates** - Depending on category, update service/cambelt dates
3. Click **Complete Task**

articles.title: How do I add comments to a workshop task?
articles.summary: Using the comments system for task updates.
articles.content_md:
# How do I add comments to a workshop task?

## Accessing Comments

1. Find the task in the list
2. Click the **comments** (speech bubble) icon
3. A drawer opens from the side showing the comment thread

## Adding a Comment

1. Type your message in the input field
2. Click **Send** or press Enter
3. Your comment is added with your name and timestamp

## What to Include

- Progress updates ("Ordered replacement hose")
- Issues encountered ("Waiting for specialist tool")
- Handover notes ("Dave to continue Monday")
- Completion details ("Replaced headlight bulb")

## Viewing History

All comments are preserved, creating a complete audit trail of the work done.

articles.title: How do I review and approve submissions? (Managers)

articles.title: How do I approve or reject a timesheet?
articles.summary: Step-by-step timesheet approval process.
articles.content_md:
# How do I approve or reject a timesheet?

## Quick Approval

1. Go to **Approvals** ‚Üí **Timesheets** tab
2. Find the pending timesheet (amber "Pending" badge)
3. Click **Approve** button
4. The status changes to Approved (green)

## Quick Rejection

1. Find the pending timesheet
2. Click **Reject** button
3. Enter comments explaining what needs correction
4. Confirm rejection

The employee will be notified and can edit and resubmit.

## Detailed Review

1. Click on the timesheet row to open the detail view
2. Review:
   - Daily hours and entries
   - Job numbers
   - Remarks
   - Employee signature
3. Approve or reject from the detail view

## Timesheet Actions After Approval

Approved timesheets can be:
- **Processed** - Marked as processed for payroll
- **Adjusted** - Modified if corrections needed (rare)

articles.title: How do I approve or reject absence requests?
articles.summary: Processing leave requests.
articles.content_md:
# How do I approve or reject absence requests?

## From the Absences Tab

1. Go to **Approvals** ‚Üí **Absences** tab
2. Review pending requests showing:
   - Employee name
   - Absence type
   - Dates and duration

3. Click **Approve** or **Reject**

The card shows the employee's:
- Total allowance

articles.title: What are Toolbox Talks?
articles.summary: Overview of the messaging system for safety communications.
articles.content_md:
# What are Toolbox Talks?

**Note:** Sending is for Managers and Admins only. All employees can receive.

## Purpose

Toolbox Talks are important safety messages that:
- Communicate critical safety information
- Require employee acknowledgment
- Create a record of who has read and understood the message

## Types of Messages

### Toolbox Talk (High Priority)

- **Blocking** - Employees cannot use the app until signed
- Requires digital signature to acknowledge
- Used for critical safety information

### Reminder (Low Priority)

- **Non-blocking** - Employees can dismiss after reading
- General information or updates
- No signature required

articles.title: How do I send a Toolbox Talk?
articles.summary: Creating and sending important safety messages.
articles.content_md:
# How do I send a Toolbox Talk?

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Steps

1. Go to **Toolbox Talks** from the sidebar
2. You'll be on the **Create Toolbox Talk** tab by default
3. Fill in:
   - **Title** - Clear, descriptive title
   - **Message** - Full content of the talk
   - **Recipients** - Select employees or "All Employees"
4. Click **Send**

## After Sending

- Recipients receive a notification
- When they next use the app, a blocking modal appears
- They must sign to acknowledge before continuing
- Track signatures in the Reports tab

articles.title: How do I send a Reminder?
articles.summary: Creating and sending low-priority reminder messages.
articles.content_md:
# How do I send a Reminder?

**Note:** This is for Managers and Admins only.

## Steps

1. Go to **Toolbox Talks** from the sidebar
2. Click the **Create Reminder** tab
3. Fill in:
   - **Title** - Brief title
   - **Message** - Content
   - **Recipients** - Select employees
4. Click **Send**

## Difference from Toolbox Talk

Reminders are:
- Non-blocking (employees can dismiss after reading)
- Lower priority
- No signature required
- Good for general updates and announcements

articles.title: How do I track Toolbox Talk signatures?

articles.title: How do I delete a user?

**Note:** This is for Admins only.

## Steps

2. Find the user in the list
3. Click **Delete** (trash) icon
4. Choose deletion mode:

### Keep Company Data (Recommended)

- Personal account is deleted
- Timesheets, inspections, etc. are preserved

articles.title: How do roles and permissions work?
articles.summary: Understanding the role-based access control system.
articles.content_md:
# How do roles and permissions work?

## The System

Squires uses Role-Based Access Control (RBAC):
- **Roles** define job types (Admin, Manager, Employee-Civils, etc.)
- **Permissions** control which modules each role can access

## Module Permissions

Each role can have access to these modules:
- Timesheets
- Inspections
- RAMS
- Absence
- Maintenance
- Workshop Tasks
- Toolbox Talks (receiving)

## Role Types

### Manager/Admin Roles

Marked with "Is Manager/Admin" flag:
- Automatically have full access to all modules
- Can access Approvals, Actions, Reports
- Can create items on behalf of employees

### Employee Roles

Access controlled by individual permissions:
- Each module can be enabled/disabled
- Different employee types can have different access

articles.title: How do I manage roles? (Admin)

articles.content_md:
# How do I manage roles? (Admin)

**Note:** This is for Admins only.

## Accessing Roles

1. Go to **Users**
2. Click the **Roles** tab

## Viewing Roles

See all roles with:
- Name and display name
- Description
- User count (how many users have this role)
- Permission count (modules enabled)

## Creating a New Role

1. Click **Add Role**
2. Enter:
   - **Name** (internal identifier, e.g., "employee-electrician")
   - **Display Name** (shown in UI, e.g., "Electrician")
   - **Description** (optional)
   - **Is Manager/Admin** - Toggle for full access
3. Save the role

## Editing Permissions

1. Click on a role row to expand
2. Toggle modules on/off using checkboxes:
   - ‚òëÔ∏è Enabled - User can access this module
   - ‚òê Disabled - User cannot access
3. Changes save automatically

## Deleting Roles

A role can only be deleted if no users are assigned to it.

articles.title: What roles cannot be modified?
articles.summary: Understanding protected system roles.
articles.content_md:
# What roles cannot be modified?

## Protected Roles

Some roles have restrictions:

### Super Admin

- Cannot be edited or deleted
- Only the account admin@mpdee.co.uk has this
- Cannot be locked out by other admins
- Has all permissions always

### Admin & Manager

- Core permissions cannot be disabled
- Always have full module access
- "Is Manager/Admin" flag cannot be removed

## Deleting Roles

A role cannot be deleted if:
- Users are still assigned to it
- It's a protected system role

Reassign users to another role first, then delete.

articles.title: How do notifications work?

## The Bell Icon

Click the bell in the top navigation to see notifications.

## Types of Notifications

- **Toolbox Talks** - New safety messages requiring signature (blocking)
- **Reminders** - Informational messages (dismissible)

articles.title: The app won't load - what should I do?
articles.summary: Troubleshooting loading issues.
articles.content_md:
# The app won't load - what should I do?

## Basic Steps

1. **Check internet connection** - Ensure you have WiFi or mobile data
2. **Refresh the page** - Pull down to refresh (mobile) or press F5 (desktop)
3. **Clear browser cache** - In browser settings, clear cached data
4. **Try a different browser** - Chrome or Safari recommended

## PWA Issues

If using the installed app:
1. Delete the app from home screen
2. Clear browser cache
3. Revisit the website
4. Re-add to home screen

## Still Not Working?

Contact your administrator with:
- What you were trying to do
- Any error messages shown
- Your device type and browser

articles.title: I can't log in - what should I do?
articles.summary: Troubleshooting login problems.
articles.content_md:
# I can't log in - what should I do?

## Check Credentials

- **Email** - Make sure it's your work email (correctly spelled)
- **Password** - Check caps lock, try typing in a text field first

## Forgot Password?

Contact your administrator - they can reset it from User Management.

## Account Locked?

If you've tried too many times, wait a few minutes before trying again.

## New Account?

If you just joined:
- Check your email for welcome message with temporary password
- Password must be changed on first login

## Still Not Working?

Ask your administrator to:
- Verify your account exists
- Reset your password
- Check your role permissions

articles.title: My data isn't saving - what's wrong?
articles.summary: Troubleshooting data save issues.
articles.content_md:
# My data isn't saving - what's wrong?

## Check Connection

You need internet to save data. Check:
- WiFi or mobile data is active
- You're not in airplane mode
- The offline banner isn't showing

## Required Fields

Make sure all required fields are filled:
- Look for error messages in red
- Required fields are marked with *
- Defect comments are required when marking items as Failed

## Session Expired

If you've been idle too long:
- You may need to log in again
- Try refreshing and logging back in

## Validation Errors

- Week ending must be a Sunday
- Duplicate inspections for same vehicle/week aren't allowed
- All days must have entries or be marked "Did Not Work"

## Try Again

1. Refresh the page
2. Re-enter the data
3. Click save again
4. If still failing, note any error message and contact admin

articles.title: I'm getting 'Access Denied' - why?
articles.summary: Understanding permission errors.
articles.content_md:
# I'm getting 'Access Denied' - why?

## Role Permissions

You may not have permission for that feature:
- Your role determines what you can access
- Ask your admin if you need access

## Manager-Only Features

Some features require Manager or Admin role:
- Approvals
- Manager Actions
- Toolbox Talks (sending)
- Reports
- Workshop Tasks (creating/managing)

## Admin-Only Features

Some features require Admin role:
- User Management
- Role Management
- Vehicle Management (Vehicles tab)
- FAQ Editor
- Fleet Settings

## What To Do

1. Check if the feature is appropriate for your role
2. Contact your administrator if you need access
3. They can update your role permissions
